data.title: FULL LIST: Winners of 49th Metro Manila Film Festival
data.meta_description:
“Firefly” bagged the Best Picture award and two other honors at the 49th Metro Manila Film Festival’s (MMFF) Gabi ng Parangal on Wednesday, Dec. 27.
T
data.text:
“Firefly” bagged the Best Picture award and two other honors at the 49th Metro Manila Film Festival’s (MMFF) Gabi ng Parangal on Wednesday, Dec. 27.

The historical film “GomBurZa” trailed behind as 2nd Best Picture while securing six other awards, taking home the most honors for this year’s MMFF.

“Mallari” won the 3rd Best Picture and three other honors while “When I Met You In Tokyo” bagged the 4th Best Picture award.

Emerging actor Cedrick Juan won the Best Actor award for his portrayal of Padre José Burgos in “GomBurZa”. He dedicated his win to the Filipinos who failed to get the justice they deserved, likening it to the titular Catholic priests’ story that they portrayed in the film.

Vilma Santos emerged victorious as Best Actress for the film “When I Met You In Tokyo”. She cried through her speech, saying her win was unexpected as she only ever wanted Filipinos to get back to watching in cinemas.

Miles Ocampo secured the Best Supporting Actress award for the film “Family of Two”, and said that for decades since she started her career as a child, this was the first time she ever received an award.

JC Santos also won the Best Supporting Actor for the film “Mallari” in a roster of nominees.

Best Actress: Vilma Santos for "When I Met You In Tokyo"

Best Actor: Cedrick Juan for "Gomburza"

Best Supporting Actress: Miles Ocampo for "Family Of Two"

Best Supporting Actor: JC Santos for "Mallari"

Best Director: Pepe Diokno for "Gomburza"

Best Screenplay: Angeli Atienza for "Firefly"

Best Child Performer: Euwann Mikaell of "Firefly"

Best Cinematography: Carlo Canlas Mendoza for "Gomburza"

Best Editing: Benjamin Tolentino for "(K)ampon"

Best Production Design: Ericson Navarro for "Gomburza"

Best Original Theme Song: "Finggah Lickin" from "Becky and Badette"

Best Visual Effects: Gaspar Mangarin for "Mallari"

Best Musical Score: Von de Guzman for "Mallari"

Best Sound: Melvin Q. Rivera and Louie Boy Bauson for "Gomburza"

Best Float: "When I Met You In Tokyo"
